answers.answer: I would try giving him 1 mg. of melatonin at night for the time being.  This will help strengthen his night time biorhythm.Endocrine disorders such as uncontrolled hypothyroid or hyperthyroid, cushings syndrome, addison's disease, and diabetes,  to name a few , can cause neurological symptoms.  Sometimes when a dog is afflicted with one endocrine disorder, he may also have additional endocrine disorders.  It might be a good idea to have your dog checked for other endocrine disorders, and also have routine bloodwork performed including CBC/CHEM, Heartworm,Lyme,Erlichia,Anaplasmosis, and Rocky Mountain Spotted Fever, and urinalysis.Some seizure disorders have unusual symptoms as you describe.  It would be a good idea to videotape your dog when he exhibits these behaviors to show to your vet.The drug Anipryl is helpful for canine cognitive dysfunction and for the symptoms of cushing's syndrome.  Anipryl is a fairly safe drug and could be tried as a therapeutic trial.

question: We have a cocker spaniel that is about 9 years old.  Sometimes during the night, he wakes up very confused.  He runs to the door and acts like he wants out, but he stands at the wrong corner of the door.  He acts like he can't remember how to jump off the bed.  He acts very anxious and nervous.  He gets on and off the bed, etc.  This only happens during the night.  We have never noticed any similar behavior during the day.  Also, it sometimes happens one time a week or not at all, and sometimes it's more frequent.  He is currently taking thyroid medication daily.  Any ideas on what it is or what we should do?
title: Dog confused during the night
